  • Element
com.lhings.library

Annotation Type Action


  • @Documented
@Retention(value=RUNTIME)
public @interface Action
    Actions represent what a device can do. You can define as many actions for a device as needed. Annotate the method that implements the action with this annotation. The method must return void. If your method has arguments, you must provide an array with the argument names, and another one with the argument types. Argument types do not refer to java types, but to the types recognized by the Lhings platform, which are the following:
    • integer: use this type for int and long data types.
    • float: use this type for float and double data types.
    • string: use this type for String data types
    • boolean: use this type for boolean data types.
    • timestamp: use this type for Date data types

      • Required Element Summary

        Required Elements 
        Modifier and Type Required Element and Description
        String description
        The description of your action.
        String[] inputsName
        An array of strings that define the arguments your action needs.
        String[] inputsType
        An array of strings telling which are the argument types.
        String name
        Used to define the name of the action.

      • Element Detail

        • name

          public abstract String name
          Used to define the name of the action. Valid character for action names are [A-Za-z0-9]
          Returns:

        • description

          public abstract String description
          The description of your action. This description will appear in the control panel of the Lhings web interface.
          Returns:

        • inputsName

          public abstract String[] inputsName
          An array of strings that define the arguments your action needs. For example, if the method annotated with Action is public void doExampleAction(int number, boolean yesOrNo), the value of inputsName must be {"number", "yesOrNo"}.
          Returns:

        • inputsType

          public abstract String[] inputsType
          An array of strings telling which are the argument types. Following the previous example, its value must be {"integer", "boolean"}.
          Returns:
